CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 26, 1957, pg. 1, reads: "2,500 Hear Jackie Robinson - Part of the crowd of more than 2,500 persons, which jammed the confines (inside and outside) of Wesley Center AME Zion Church, Monday night, is shown listening to Branch Rickey, the man who broke the color line in organized baseball, as he blasted racial bias and introduced Jackie Robinson, his protege. Robinson is national chairman of the NAACP's million-dollar  '1957 Fight for Freedom Fund.'  Eager listeners pledged over $3,500, of which $1,529 was in cash, to the fund.  Seven life memberships ($500 each) are included in this amount. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Jackie Robinson speaking to crowd, with Branch Rickey on left, in Wesley Center AME Zion Church, for NAACP fundraiser "1957 Fight for Freedom Fund"
